itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Frank Andrews (14 February 1886 – 22 November 1944) was an English-born Welsh rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1910s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for Wales, and at club level for Pontypool RFC, as a back row, i.e. flanker or number eight, and club level rugby league (RL) for Hunslet.

response: *Frank Andrews (1886–1944), international rugby union (Wales) and professional rugby league player

* Frank Andrews (rugby) (1886–1944), Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer
* Frank Andrews (singer) (born 1985), contestant from Season 2 of New Zealand Idol
* Frank Andrews (actor) (c. 1860–1935), Broadway and silent film actor in The Warrens of Virginia (1924 film)
* Frank Andrews Shimkus (born 1952), often known as Frank Andrews, former journalist and Pennsylvania State Representative
